Name: Astronomy: A Self-Teaching Guide, Seventh Edition (Wiley Self-Teaching Guides)

ReviewList.Text: I'm a mother who doesn't know much about astronomy but now I've found a resource to use when my kids ask me questions about the stars and planets.  This is an easy-to-read guide for parents who are not experts.

This book provides an excellent introduction to astronomy.  It is up to date with excellent photographs and clear explanations.  I would highly recommend this book to students in astronomy classes as well as people who wish to learn about astronomy as a hobby.

A very good book for little more than a beginner.  Would have been nice to have colored pictures, but then the cost would have been higher.  However, the diagrams and black and white photos were good enough to relate to the information.  The book met the requirements for the purpose of what it was meant for.  I would rate it as a 4 1/2.

This is the nicest, most thoughtfully presented intro to astronomy I have ever come across. Every aspect of this gem is outstanding. Great diagrams, clearly presented concepts, well paced....dirt cheap. It is organized just like a self paced course, with frequent quizzes and end of chapter tests. If you want to start off in astronomy with one excellent book, this would be the one. I just wish I had of discovered it years ago. I'm using the 5th edition. I would presume subsequent editions to be at least as good.
Our daughter is competing in the Science Olympiad. We purchased several Astronomy books for Christmas. This one is straight forward and we love the review and practice tests. We recommend this book.

Well written and easy to understand.  The self help tests and quizzes reinforce information learned.  Diagrams make understanding quite easy.  I recommend this book for new to the subject matter especially.
If you want to take an Astronomy class but don't have the time or money then pick this book up instead.

Well, I've only come across maybe 2 or 3 well constructed text books on our galaxy. One of which, would be this one. I initially purchased it for my curious wonders of astronomy. But also being President of an Astronomy Club, this text really comes in handy. I'm able to answer any and most questions about everything up in space. I recommend this book with 4/5 stars. Very cool read if you're into all things science, or just astronomy in general.
Used for my astronomy class. Worked great. Needed to supplement it with online sources as some of the topics were just briefly covered. After all it is just a self teaching guide. :)
Very easy to read and understand. The book starts from the elemental astronomy things. Recommended for begginers. Perhaps the e-book version is not the best way to see the drawings.

A very-easy to understand guide to this fascinating topic! Great to have in conjunction with a college class, or for any age person who is interested in astronomy.  Easy to use format makes it a perfect choice for anyone who wants to learn more about the sky above us!
Written in a manner that anyone can understand. Very informative. I will continue to use it as my main Astronomy resource.
What a wonderful, clear guide to astronomy! Easy to understand for beginners and superb photos. Very helpful!

So happy to get this newest, updated edition.  So easy to read!  The self-tests at the end of each chapter are very helpful and the numerous online references come in handy.  My college-aged son used the previous edition for class and recommended it to me, but told me to wait for the newer edition.  So glad I did.  I give 5 stars to this book about the stars!

Certainly a very good reading for beginners, only one or two equations and really amazing pictures, even in this Kindle edition. I have come to think that images are what astronomy is all about for a non scientist like me and the book is rich not only in beautiful pictures but also in resources and links that will direct you to uncountable ones. The content is also adequately broad and up to date.

I really enjoy programs such as The Universe and How the Universe Works. This books covers very similar concepts to give you a broader understanding of the universe and your home on the earth. The self teaching principle is also quite useful...the test questions help you confirm your understanding before moving on to the next section or chapter. S

All that I can say is that this book delivers, no negatrives. Not an easy subject. If you don't disipline yourself to seriously study the material you will fail to grasp it. Don't blame the book. The subject itself can be overwhelming there is no way around it. Not light reading for your commute or trip to the loo.
The wording was very difficult to understand so it had a problem keeping me motivated. The book was a little warn but still in a nice state.
I enjoy reading/learning from this book. Really Easy to follow and teach people What you know:) I highly recommend this book for beginners!! and interest in how the universe works!!!
This is an outstanding introduction to the subject, very pleasantly written. I've had a Russian translation in hard copy for decades, and I've re-read it countless times.
This is a book that rank beginners and intermediate astronomers will both enjoy. Nice layout and easy to understand. Good addition to an amateur's library!
This is all I was looking for....and more!  Now I feel ready to move deeper into the subject.  For a person of 75, you've whetted my appetite for more.
Plenty of detail and clear explanations.  Excellent for the layman with minimal math background required to understand content of the book.
Overall this self learning guide is really professional and easy to understand. The knowledge is not to complicated but also worth to read.
This guide is an excellent book for beginners in astronomy. It starts you at basics and has lots of diagrams and pictures.
I really enjoyed the new knowledge I have gained from this book. It was very helpful and interesting.
Best astronomy book that I've read in years. And the photos are magnificent .
Excellent Book. I am using it for my Clep Exam and will update after exam.
Lots of info.  More than I needed for a hobby.  Well written.
This is one of the best Astronomy books that I have read. The explanations on the subjects are very thorough, and it covers a lot of material. I would recommend this book to beginners in Astronomy.
Excellent, easy to read and understand.
gift to grandson who has a telescope.
Perfect for the uninitiated.
I like this book, it's what I was looking for. A lot of information, maps of stars, of Moon - easy to read.
I didn't realize when I bought this that it was a textbook, went way over my 11 year old's head.

I am learning so much about Astronomy. It's simple to understand and for people who want to learn more or even major in Astronomy in college should get this book. It's giving me a great head-start for college. It had the basics in it, not many equations. The Sections are very short and about 20-30 sections make up a chapter. There is an average of 1-3 sections on one page. The chapters go fast. I love this book.
For the advanced users whom need no pictures. Either way, it would be nice to have more life like pics within the readings and in color. Very informative though and helpful.
excellent

This book is so helpful. The new edition has more information, great pictures, and is completely user friendly. I definitely recommend this book to anyone looking to learn more about Astronomy in a simple way. This books breaks down complicated and interesting information for people with and without a science background. Definitely recommend!!

Enjoy reading about the universe and solar system.  Author presents concepts that are easy to understand. Each chapter has questions and answers covering the material presented in the chapter.  It's good to understand all the questions at the end before proceding on to the next chapter.  I have a technical background in this field.

The book is very cool and educational i bought it for my boyfriend whom loves astronomy and i think hes going to love it it shipped super fast like 3days. The only reason i gave it four instead of five is because the way it was in the packaging the front cover got bent. :/ but otherwise its in great condition. :)
Thanks
Wonderful gift for my sister in law's foreign exchange student!!  He loved it....hopefully I can say in a few years that "I know that astronaut!!"  LOL!!
The best thing about this book is even before you realize it, you are learning a lot and wanting to read more! I wish every subject had a book written like this!
I like the way this book works. It gives you the answers to the chapter questions right after the questions. The way all books in school should have worked.
The book is very informative and I like testing what I should know.  I am a beginner to astronomy and hope this book will expand my knowledge.
Excellent product, great price and outstanding shipping. Highly recommended.
Very clear and very helpful guide! The pictures are wonderful, too.
This is a great way to self-teaching astronomy.
good book
Great starter for atronomy knowledge!

I don't know if I've outgrown this book, or what, but I only found it mildly interesting.  It really seems as if the author is trying to get the reader excited about astronomy, but that his idea of the reader has the mental capicity of a 6th grader.  Maybe that is for whom this book was written; if so: my bad.
I got it on time! And I bought a new book so of course I got a new one. lol I'm happy, thank you!

MANY EFFORTS ARE BEING MADE TO ADVANCE ASTRONOMY BUT THE DISCOVERY OF LIFE IN OUTER SPACE REMAINS ELUSIVE.LOGIC DETACT THAT WE ARE NOT ALONE IN THIS UNIVERSE.THERE SHOULD BE MANY MORE EARTH LIKE PLANETS OUT THERE WITH LIFE.BUT IN WHAT FORM?
